hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Rifa'ah ibn Rafi': He went out with the Prophet ﷺ to the prayer grounds in Madinah and found people trading. He called out: 'O merchants!' and they responded to him, raising their necks and their eyes towards him. He said: 'Verily, traders will be resurrected on the Day of Judgment as wrongdoers (fujjar) except for those who fear Allah, do good, and speak truthfully.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by a Companion of Badr: We were sitting with the Prophet ﷺ when a man came and prayed a hurried prayer, not completing his bowing or prostration while the Prophet ﷺ observed him and we did not notice. He finished praying and greeted the Prophet ﷺ who returned his greeting and said to him: 'Repeat, for you have not prayed.' When it was the fourth time, he said: 'O Messenger of Allah, by Allah I have tried.' The Prophet ﷺ said: 'When you stand for prayer, face the qibla, then say the takbir, then recite, then bow until you are at ease while bowing, then rise until you are at ease while standing, then prostrate until you are at ease while prostrating, then sit until you are at ease while sitting, then stand. If you do this, your prayer is complete. Whatever you fall short in, your prayer is incomplete.'

hadiths.english_translation: Malik ibn al-Tayyihan - a Balawi, an ally of Bani Abdul-Ashal, a Qaqi participant, a Badri companion, may Allah be pleased with him. His mother was Layla bint Utayk ibn Amro ibn Jasham ibn al-Harith. The Judge Abu Bakr Ahmad ibn Amro ibn Abi Asim said - and I heard Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shayba saying: His name was Malik ibn al-Tayyihan. He died in the year twenty (20 AH).

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Malik ibn al-Tayyihan: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says "Peace be upon you" (as-salamu alaikum) is written for him ten good deeds, and whoever says "Peace be upon you and the mercy of Allah" (as-salamu alaikum wa rahmatullahi) is written for him twenty good deeds, and whoever says "Peace be upon you and the mercy of Allah and His blessings" (as-salamu alaikum wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh) is written for him thirty good deeds.'
